entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND KNIK RIVER VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A strong autumn storm system over Southwest Alaska will continue to produce gusty southeasterly winds through Turnagain Arm, the Knik River Valley, and across the Anchorage Bowl Saturday morning through Sunday morning. The strongest winds and gusts are expected
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:48AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds and High Surf Possible Monday... Northwest winds gusting to 40 to 50 mph are possible on Monday and Monday Night. This will bring a chance of high surf over the Eastern Arctic Coast on Mon afternoon and Monday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:46AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels Into The Weekend... The Kobuk and Noatak River basins received 1 to 1.5 inches of rain since Thursday. Another 2 to 3 inches of rain is likely through Sunday night. The Koyukuk Basin west of the Dalton Highway, and the Kobuk and Noatak Rivers and their tributaries will reach bankfull levels Sunday with a slight chance of flooding
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels On The Nenana And Delta Rivers This Weekend... Heavy rain with 2 to 4 inches is possible through this weekend along the south slopes of the Alaska Range, including the headwaters of the Nenana and Delta Rivers. The Nenana and Delta Rivers and may rise to near bankfull levels in some low lying
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels From The Dalton Highway West This Weekend... Areas from the Dalton Highway west received between 1 to 1.5 inches of rain since Thursday. Another 2 to 3 inches of rain is likely through Sunday night. Rivers in the Koyukuk Basin west of the Dalton Highway will reach bankfull levels Sunday with a slight chance of flooding early next week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley
